column2: Choose a patron deity
Although the people of Faerun honour many gods, you may choose to devote yourself to one of them in particular.
Maybe I should choose a deity whose nature and special areas of concern are fitting to my position and governance.
One of the gods of justice and good rulership.
One of the gods of the natural world of Toril.
One of the gods of war and battle.
A god with a different sort of portfolio...
Maybe I should choose a deity who sponsors an activity which is close to my heart.
One of the gods of knowledge and creativity.
One of the gods of magic and sorcery.
One of the gods of leisure and happiness.
A god with a different sort of portfolio...
Maybe I should choose a deity who will guide me through the unexpected and difficult parts of life.
One of the gods of chance and good fortune.
One of the gods of travel and wandering.
One of the gods of death and the afterlife.
A god with a different sort of portfolio...
Choosing a god of justice will show what kind of ruler I mean to be.
Tyr, one-handed god of justice and lawmaking.
Helm, the watchful god of guardians.
Ilmater, the Crying God, patron of those who suffer.
There are others...
A lesser-known god of rulership might mark me as a thoughtful leader.
Torm the True, god of loyalty.
Siamorphe the Divine Right, goddess of nobility.
Bahamut the Platinum Dragon, god of wisdom and mercy.
Perhaps a different kind of deity after all...
Choosing a god of nature will show my concern for the lands I govern.
Chauntea the Earthmother, goddess of agriculture.
Silvanus the Forest Father, god of the wilderness.
Mielikki the Supreme Ranger, goddess of wild animals.
There are others...
Maybe a more specialised nature deity would suit me.
Eldath the Green Goddess, patron of peace and lakes.
Shiallia the Golden, goddess of fertility.
Lurue the Unicorn, queen of talking beasts.
There are yet others...
Maybe another nature deity would fit me better.
Gwaeron Windstrom, the supreme tracker.
Auril the Frostmaiden, goddess of winter.
Kossuth Firelord, primordial of flame.
Perhaps a different kind of deity after all...
Choosing a god of conflict will show the strength with which I mean to rule.
Tempus, Lord of Battles, chief god of war.
Red Knight, mistress of strategy.
Valkur the Mighty, god of sailing and raiding.
Perhaps a different kind of deity after all...
Choosing a god of knowledge or the secular arts will show my commitment to learning.
Oghma the Binder, god of knowledge.
Gond Wonderbringer, master of invention.
Milil, Lord of Song, god of the secular creative arts.
There are others...
A different deity of knowledge might be more suitable.
Deneir the First Scribe, god of literature.
Perhaps a different kind of deity after all...
Dedicating myself to a god of magic will show my respect for the True Art.
Mystra, personification of the Weave, goddess of all magic.
Azuth, god of wizards and spellcraft.
Leira, goddess of illusion and mystery.
There are others...
Maybe another god of magic would suit me better.
Savras the All-Seeing, god of divination.
Perhaps a different kind of deity after all...
Worshipping a god of leisure and happiness will show that I mean to be a bountiful ruler.
Lathander the Morninglord, god of dawn, daylight, and renewal.
Sune Firehair, goddess of beauty and passion.
Lliira Joybringer, goddess of happiness and dance.
Maybe another deity of pleasure is more suitable.
Worshipping a deity of pleasure and the senses would show I enjoy the good things in life.
Sharess, goddess of sexuality and sensual pleasure.
Perhaps a different kind of deity after all...
Honouring a deity of chance and good fortune will show that I wish good things for my people.
Tymora, goddess of good luck.
Waukeen, goddess of commerce and prosperity.
Perhaps a different kind of deity after all...
Worshipping a god of travel will demonstrate my concern for wayfarers in my domains.
Selûne the Moonmaiden, goddess of navigation and of the cycles of life.
Shaundakul the Rider of the Winds, god of the winds, travellers and exploration.
Finder Wyvernspur, god of change and transition.
Perhaps a different kind of deity after all...
Worshipping a god of death will represent my seriousness and concern for the future.
Kelemvor, Lord of the Dead, judge of the afterlife.
Jergal, the Scribe of Death, recorder of deeds.
Perhaps a different kind of deity after all...
